At Lyst, we work in small self-managing, autonomous teams with end-to-end responsibility for a specific customer-focused project. This structure brings together Lysters from all the disciplines that are needed to deliver the squad’s goals. We reward these squads for the impact they make and value the innovative approaches that autonomy and alignment can bring. We hire great people and get out of their way.  
  
**Role Overview**  
  
The position is part of the “International tribe”, a recently-created and fast-growing team in charge of launching and growing Lyst in non-English speaking markets. Reporting to the newly appointed SVP International, you will be responsible for growing Lyst’s DACH region, covering Germany, Austria and Switzerland.   
  
This is a unique opportunity to make a large impact on a fast-growing start-up, with a high degree of autonomy to craft and execute locally relevant strategies on both the demand and supply side.

At a high level, you will fully own and manage the P&L for the DACH region. Using a data-driven, “test & learn” approach, you will identify and drive a number of initiatives on the demand and supply side to grow Lyst’s DACH business. You will be supported by central Marketing and Supply teams, who you will closely partner with to achieve your objectives.

In the first few months, a particular focus will be on supply expansion to ensure Lyst has partnerships with suppliers most relevant to DACH consumers.

**Responsibilities**

- Define and execute growth strategy for DACH, identifying opportunities on both the demand and supply side
- Own the DACH region’s P&L, including day-to-day performance management to achieve financial targets 
- Work closely with central Marketing teams (including SEM and SEO) to define and monitor marketing strategies and performance 
- Drive supply acquisition end-to-end to increase local relevance in the DACH market - from target identification to negotiation of commercial agreements
- Understand local consumer preferences and feed into Product roadmap 
- Build and nurture relationships with partners and affiliate networks

**Requirements**

- Native/fluent German speaker, in-depth knowledge of the local German business culture (required)
- Interest in fashion, and some knowledge of local fashion brands and retailers (preferred) 
- At least 3 years of proven work experience; experience in management consulting, VC or high growth firms (ideally E-commerce) particularly relevant
- Basic understanding of E-commerce and its main performance drivers preferred 
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills: from hypothesis generation to data analysis and formulating recommendations 
- Advanced Excel (required), experience with BI solutions such as Tableau or Looker (preferred) 
- Adaptable, resourceful, comfortable working in a fast-paced and fast-changing environment 
- Driven, result-oriented, self-motivated, proactive
- Strong attention to detail 
- Strong business acumen 
- Demonstrated experience working cross-functionally and influencing stakeholders who don’t report to the role 
- Strong negotiation skills - prior experience interacting with third parties a plus 
- Strong written and verbal communication skills
- Strong project management skills, ability to manage multiple projects at once in a complex matrix environment

- Private Healthcare by Vitality - your health is important to us which is why we offer all employees a comprehensive healthcare scheme from Day One
- The Lyst Clothing Benefit. We're a fashion company so we'll give you £250 to spend on the site in Year 1, £500 in Year 2, £750 in Year 3 and £1000 from Year 4 onwards. You're going to look fantastic!

- Your conference tickets are paid for - we’re big on learning and development and encourage everyone to attend events. In fact, we go further and all Lysters get £1,500, $1,900 to spend on conferences, courses and training.
- Eyecare – Discounted eye tests and glasses
- Regular yoga classes, 5 a-side football and netball teams to encourage a healthy work/life balance
- Cycle to work scheme
- Transport Season ticket loans
- Team meet-ups twice a month to share some of the interesting things we’re working on internally and externally
- Social events - from table-top games to climbing, movie nights to triathlons, you’ll find a group of people always keen to get involved

- Build and lead teams comprising Product, Design & User Research, and implement best-in-class operational frameworks for those functions
- Communicate the Product strategy effectively across the organisation, ensuring buy-in and alignment from Squads and senior stakeholders
- Support and coach Squad Leads and functional reports to devise roadmaps, set measurable goals, hire the right talent and ultimately deliver on your Product strategy

jobs.title: Senior Product Designer
jobs.description:
We want to make it easy for anyone to find the fashion they're looking for, whatever their style. We’re doing this by building a truly global fashion search platform.

 

As a Senior Product Designer at Lyst, you’ll own and drive the entire design process from its earliest stages through to shipping and iterating on a feature. Alongside product managers, user researchers and engineers, you’ll ensure that every product decision we make builds value for both our business and our users.

 

**Company**

Lyst is the largest fashion search platform in the world. In the last year, over 80 million shoppers used the platform, which in the last twelve months launched localised experiences in 14 countries including France, Germany, Russia and Japan. Lyst brings together an unparalleled inventory of 5 million products from 12,000 partners ranging from Gap to Gucci.

 

Established in 2010 and with a team of around 140 engineers, product designers, product managers, marketeers, stylists and more, we are serving both our customers as well as our brand partners with every feature we build. This requires both commercial sensitivity as well as user-centred thinking, and means there are plenty of complex and exciting design and research challenges to solve.

Recently, we’ve been working on:

- More powerful tools for searching a massive inventory. We have millions of fashion items on Lyst, so how do we blend design and data science to only show what's relevant?
- Smarter ways to learn about our customers' preferences, and more useful ways to filter results. How can we build something that gets better every time you use it?
- New ways of inspiring our customers - how can we help everyone discover and access the world’s fashion?

**Team and Role**

You will join our growing team of product designers, and work primarily with one of our many cross-functional product teams. Over time, you’ll get to work on many areas of Lyst’s product surface, solving design problems on behalf of our customers and brand partners.

Specifically, you will:

- Design effective and delightful experiences that solve a real user problem and create value for the business
- Accompany every feature and product you work on from idea through to launch and iteration - you’ll own all stages of the design process
- Work in close collaboration with user research to understand user problems, validate hypotheses and iterate
- Help us improve as a team and company. You’ll contribute to an inclusive and positive working environment for everyone, ensure we leverage design effectively, interview potential new team members, introduce new practices, mentor others, and help us build a more user-centred culture.

**Requirements**

What matters most to us is your expertise, mindset and what makes you, you - rather than a particular career path or background. The below is to give you a sense of what we’re generally looking for. Please do consider applying even if you feel that not all of these apply to you - if we can help you improve and grow in some of these areas, all the better!

 
- Experience working as a product designer in an in-house environment - ideally you will have worked in close collaboration with user researchers, product managers and engineers and know how to bring out the best in all of them
- Commercial pragmatism - you’ll have a keen interest in how the business works, and will be able to translate this into your own decision-making
- Thoughtful approach to design - your decisions will be based around a deep understanding of the problem to solve
- A flexible way of working and a broad toolkit - you’ll be autonomous and able to adjust your process to suit the project
- Great listening and communication skills - you’ll be able to communicate complex ideas clearly and concisely to colleagues at all levels of the business 

**Benefits**

jobs.description:
Lyst is a Global Fashion Search Platform which connects millions of shoppers globally with the world’s leading fashion designers and stores, giving them a simpler, more engaging buying experience. Lyst brings together an unparalleled inventory of 8 million products from 12,000 partners ranging from Gap to Gucci.

As VP of Engineering you will own the technical leadership in our tribe/squad structure, partnering with our business leaders. You will coordinate with your peers in the leadership level across the other tribes. You will guide technical strategy, manage squad leads, participate in company-wide planning, and be a pillar of our engineering culture.

 

Lyst’s mission is to create the place where customers around the world start their fashion search and decide what to buy. Our technical challenge is to provide customers with the widest, most up-to-date, and most intelligent inventory on the web. We integrate with thousands of partners, pulling in tens of millions of product updates daily, to serve hundreds of millions of customers. We need leadership that can understand how to scale teams and technology, who can manage technology as an investment for the business, and who can build strategic assets for the future.

### Responsibilities 
 
- Lead and manage our Data & Services Platform Tribe
- Be part of the technical leadership for your tribe – shaping its strategies and helping to grow an amazing organization
- Manage hiring and attracting of high quality engineering talent for your tribe 

- Create a safe and inclusive working atmosphere 
- Make sure that teams are efficient, they focus on the right things and make the right decisions in a timely manner

- Considerable management experience 
- Ability to translate business strategies into technical strategies
- Comfortable in dealing with budgets
- Ability to drive roadmaps
- Ability to hire and lead high-caliber, data focused teams

- Experienced and and ability to give high level technical guidance
- Agile background -- able to lead teams through agile process, prioritization, challenging decisions
- Process minded -- able to apply and adapt processes
- Growth oriented -- be an agent of change, lead teams through continual improvement

- Grow people and teams through coaching, mentoring, and feedback
- Alongside your peers you will contribute to the overall strategic vision 
- Continuously evolve and guide the technical expertise of your team e.g performance, maintainability, reliability engineering, security and managing technical debt
- Instil a spirit of continuous improvement in the tribe's code, architecture, and processes
- Ability to understand how engineering fits in and supports overall business strategy
- Build a high trust, collaborative, respectful and inclusive environment in which to work
- Work with the talent team to attract, onboard and retain diverse top talent
- Work closely with your peers in Product and Design to set the vision for the product area, build and communicate strategy, and improve ways of working as a team

**Who you are:**

 
- You are experienced in building, leading and mentoring cross-functional development teams
- Passionate about delivering valuable, working software systems with them.
- You love developing and growing people.
- You can motivate and instil a strong sense of ownership in your team.
- You're very commercial and impact-driven.

Lyst is seeking a performance marketing leader to help accelerate our growth. **Responsibility:**

- Lead a multi-disciplined marketing team of 4+ (Product, Analysts and Operations’ specialists) to drive in-market audiences to Lyst’s web and App properties. - Comfortable communicating with different disciplines; Engineering, Product, Finance & Partnerships
- Proven ability to continuously communicate/influence longer term strategy with peers and leadership
- All round marketing, industry knowledge and commercial understanding
- Previous experience working in an environment which is fast paced and performance focused
- Understanding of client side (Supply) to be able to guide and influence all aspects of buying power
- Proven ability to continuously communicate/influence longer term strategy with peers and leadership is crucial
- Built, developed multiple teams with different performance objectives/key results simultaneously
- Are able to deliver under pressure and can motivate themselves to keep on going that extra mile day in day out

jobs.title: SEO Director
jobs.description:
We are looking for an SEO Director to accelerate our growth at Lyst.

Our approach is truly customer-focused and data lies at the heart of our business. We take a lean, iterative and technology focused approach to solving the problems we face. Our teams are focused on growing our business and SEO lies at the heart of our global growth strategy. SEO represents a significant channel for the business and we have a team of engineers and product managers dedicated to delivering SEO growth.

As SEO Director you will take ownership of SEO strategy and execution to ensure that we continue to be at the forefront of the way customers browse and shop for fashion. Working closely with our highly skilled team of Product Managers, Engineers, Designers and User Researchers, you will take ownership of SEO initiatives and lead experiments to deliver growth, in line with company wide goals.

Your day to day role will include:

- Leading the advancement of the SEO strategy (driving alignment and execution)
- Owning the P&L for SEO, including defining and owning the forecast, and performance vs. plan.
- Providing leadership around Organic search, including championing truly customer focused features and experiments.
- Qualifying, sizing and executing on initiatives that have the propensity to deliver large scale growth (across all marketplaces)
- Working alongside Product and Engineering teams to ensure our website changes deliver positive improvements to the metrics we care about.
- Leading complex deep dives to understand performance gaps and opportunities to unlock growth
- Defining and owning the SEO roadmap, covering website architecture, crawling, indexing and data quality.
- Leading, mentoring and managing the SEO team, ensuring the team is aligned and are capitalising on the largest opportunities (across all global marketplaces)
- Separating the signal from the noise when it comes to SEO performance.

**Requirements**

This is a senior role at Lyst and we are looking for someone who is looking for a new challenge where they will be able to make an impact on aspects of a business whose lifeblood is traffic. Minimum five years of relevant SEO experience (ideally in e-commerce).

You will be:

- An Executor with a proven track record delivering projects at scale with pace, precision and excellence. Able to effortlessly bring data-driven ideas which have the propensity to deliver meaningful growth, to fruition.
- Analytical. You will have the ability to drive a data focus in all decisions for both your teams and the wider business. Your deep personal expertise in data analysis will allow you to uncover, detail, visualise and solve some of the fundamental challenges regarding enterprise level SEO in a logical manner.
- Growth Minded, because SEO is intrinsically linked to the growth of our platform and our business. You will have experienced exponential growth in an SEO role, ideally where you'd led a team or a business. You will be continually able to find, prioritise and pivot to opportunities for expansion and performance improvement as part of a clear strategy for SEO growth.
- Equal in both the detail and the big picture. The traits in people that we especially value at Lyst are ownership, humility, talent (over experience), impact and drive. We value raw intelligence, and would choose the ability to learn quickly over decades of experience. As the world around us is changing quickly, experience is not always as valuable as it used to be. It can also limit us from adopting new, better ways of doing things. Specially for non-paid growth, you’ll be expected to both dive very deep on the detail, as well as take a broad strategic view.
- A Leader, open minded, engaging and mission driven. You will be able to integrate different functional groups to form a consensus for core aims and delivery expectations. Highly visible personal integrity, credibility and influencing skills.
- Experienced with large scale technical SEO. You have experience working with large (multi-million page) websites, delivering content and link strategy. You’re also very creative and are constantly coming up with new, imaginative solutions to solve problems and deliver growth.

**Benefits**

- Private Healthcare by Vitality. Your health is important to us which is why we offer all employees a comprehensive healthcare scheme.
- The Lyst Clothing Benefit. We're a fashion company so we'll give you £250 to spend on the site in Year 1, £500 in Year 2, £750 in Year 3 and £1000 from Year 4 onwards. You're going to look fantastic!
- Time off. You get 29 days throughout the year.
- Conferences and events. We’re big on learning and development, so all Lysters get £1500 to spend on courses and training.
- Sports and exercise. We have regular yoga classes, table tennis, 5-a-side football and netball to encourage a healthy work-life balance
- Team meet-ups. We get together twice a month to share some of the interesting things we’re working on internally and externally
- Social events. Join in with board games or film nights, or start something new! You’ll find a group of people always keen to get involved.
